verses.roman:
sakāma-bhakte 'ajña' jāni' dayālu bhagavān
sva-caraṇa diyā kare icchāra pidhāna

synonyms: sakāma-bhakte—to devotees who still have material desires to fulfill; ajña—foolish; jāni'-knowing; dayālu—merciful; bhagavān—Śrī Kṛṣṇa; sva-caraṇa—His own lotus feet; diyā—giving; kare—does; icchāra pidhāna—the covering of other desires.
translation: "When the merciful Lord Kṛṣṇa understands a devotee's foolish desire for material prosperity, He gratefully gives him the shelter of His lotus feet. In this way, the Lord covers his undesirable ambitions.
